# World Electricity Production
## Ingest a csv file with BOM encoding

```{r, out.width="60%", fig.align="center", fig.cap="Photo by Michael Dziedzic on Unsplash"}

masthead <- "assets/michael-dziedzic-unsplash.jpg"
knitr::include_graphics(masthead, dpi=72)

```

> Every decoding is another encoding...\
--- David Lodge\

***

The first character is a magical character, invisible to the human eye, but readible by a computer. It is the byte order mark (or BOM) and itâ€™s telling the computer that the characters that follow are encoded in Unicode. This issue will often arise when saving to a CSV file from a spreadsheet.

### Ingest
#### without considering BOM

```{r load-data, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

url_root <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/UN-AVT/kamino-source/main/sources/0-shared/data/"
url_file <- "world-electricity-production/world-electricity-production-bom.csv"
url <- paste0(url_root, url_file)

df_no_bom <- read.csv(url, header = TRUE)

df_no_bom

names(df_no_bom)
```


### Ingest
#### recognizing BOM encoding


```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

url_root <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/UN-AVT/kamino-source/main/sources/0-shared/data/"
url_file <- "world-electricity-production/world-electricity-production-bom.csv"
url <- paste0(url_root, url_file)

df_bom <- read.csv(url, header = TRUE, fileEncoding = 'UTF-8-BOM')

df_bom

names(df_bom)

```
